summary: This document provides a brief overview of the solar eclipse phenomenon and why it occurs.
bullet_points: A solar eclipse happens when the Moon passes between Earth and the Sun.
Total eclipses reveal the Sun's corona.
Eclipses occur only during a new moon.
They can be partial, total, or annular depending on alignment.
visual_description: A diagram shows the Sun, Moon, and Earth aligned in a straight line, with the Moon casting a shadow on a portion of Earth.
